column3: whatever a pre-existing piece of computer software or code object is designed to run within
column5: and making use of its facilities.The term computing platform can refer to different abstraction levels
column8: and runtime libraries. In total it can be said to be the stage on which computer programs can run.Binary executables have to be compiled for a specific hardware platform
column9: since different central processor units have different machine codes. In addition
column10: operating systems and runtime libraries allow re-use of code and provide abstraction layers which allow the same high-level source code to run on differently configured hardware. For example
column11: there are many kinds of data storage device
column12: and any individual computer can have a different configuration of storage devices; but the application is able to call a generic save or write function provided by the OS and runtime libraries
column13: which then handle the details themselves.
